item.title: Get the Look: Orcondo Master
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
One of my favorite bedrooms is the “Orcondo” master designed by Orlando Soria of Hommemaker. It is the absolute perfect mix of masculine and feminine, old and new, with some surprising additions like a handmade quilt from his mom. The whole place is stunning and you can check out the full reveal on Style by Emily Henderson. Today I’m bringing you a Get the Look post for this room.  chandelier // …

The post Get the Look: Orcondo Master appeared first on STEPH PIONTKOWSKI INTERIORS.

item.title: Outdoor Dining Vision Board and July 4th Sales
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
Summer holidays are a perfect time to outfit your outdoor dining area or other parts of your backyard or patio. We are working on our backyard which is huge so we’re only focusing on the dining area currently. Here are some things I’ve ordered, or are on my wish list. At our house my husband is the client so I pulled together a vision board for him. This shows him …

item.title: Living Room Moodboard
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
Today I’m sharing our living room moodboard. Like I mentioned in my last post, this won’t be a big sweeping change but a gradual change with updates here and there. For now, we are selling the sofas, painting and getting a new sofa. But I’ll run through our plan in here and talk about some of the pieces we already have. Here’s a picture of what it looks like now-ish. …

item.title: Challenges in Rental Design
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
Rental design can be costly if you move often. We’ve been in our house for almost two years now but I haven’t done much to make it ours. Our old furniture doesn’t work in here but we hesitate to buy all new stuff for a temporary home. However…..temporary in this case might mean at least a few more years (thanks to the overpriced Southern California real estate market). We also …

The post Challenges in Rental Design appeared first on STEPH PIONTKOWSKI INTERIORS.

item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
I’m back for another monthly edit and this month’s also doubles as a Mother’s Day Gift Guide. item.title: Mama’s Sanctuary Moodboard
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
Today’s moodboard is something I created for a single mama looking to refresh her bedroom into a personal sanctuary without spending a fortune. I was able to source some inexpensive but nice looking products and give her direction on some DIY projects where I couldn’t find ideal products in her price range. This busy lady is a single working mom who is also running her own business so she needed …

item.title: Monthly Edit November 2017
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
Welcome to the Monthly Edit. These are things I either already own, want to buy or just dream about. 1 // This rug from McGee + Co is so perfect. I’d put it underneath the outdoor mat below. item.title: High Seas Nursery Reveal
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
After working on this project for a while and admittedly finishing it months ago, I’m happy to share the finished project. If you follow me on Instagram you’ve probably seen a couple of sneak peeks but now you can see it in all it’s nautical inspired glory. The client didn’t have a specific direction they wanted to go in, but I was armed with some likes and dislikes and a …

item.title: Project 62: New Home Line at Target
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
If you’re like me you like nice things, but you also have a deeply rooted, long-term relationship with Target. I love Target. I would say it’s unnatural, but come to find out I’m in good company. I go there when I need to pick up one or two things, to do some grocery shopping, and to escape when I get some kid-free time. There’s nothing like roaming every aisle very …

item.title: Tuesday Tip: Decanting
item.dc:creator: steph
item.description:
Sometimes we have to live with things that are unsightly but necessary. Not everyone cares about these things but I definitely do. I really hate ugly packaging and I have a confession….I decant. Everything. Well, a lot of things at least. When you decant things you have a chance to take something ugly and make it a little more attractive. Here’s a few examples of how I do that. This …
